wordpressPost.title: How to resist colds and viruses the natural way
wordpressPost.content:
How to resist colds and viruses the natural way

 

It’s crazy that there is no cure for the common cold yet.  I say this as I am starting to get a sore throat and a pressure in my chest.

I hate getting colds (duh! Who doesn’t right?) and, fortunately, I only get them every few years.  I seem to get them more when I travel a lot.

Okay, with that said, I hate taking medicine so I usually suffer and ride out the cold all while feeling run down at work and hiding inside until the symptoms have passed.

How to resist colds and viruses the natural way

 

So what exactly is the best way to resist colds and viruses the natural way?  Colds are caused by about 200 viruses that are constantly mutating.  As you may guess, trying to find a cure is light trying to hit a moving target.

According to some statistics, we can get a cold up to four times a year, and a child can get about twelve per year!

Most households have a ton of medicines to fight the symptoms of a cold, but as stated, there is no cure for the common cold.

Of course, it’s better to avoid getting a cold by washing your hands, keeping your hands away from your mouth, nose, and eyes.  Viruses penetrate our protective mucus and then quickly make a home in our throat.  This is me right now 🙁

Once you feel the symptoms, the virus has replicated at least 10 to 12 hours.

Once you get a cold, rest, hydrate, sip green and herbal teas.

Some safe and effective alternatives to fighting a cold

 

Once you have a cold you may want to ease congestion with a peppermint or eucalyptus steam as follows:

  1. Pour 1 1/2 quarts of boiling water into a heatproof bowl.
  2. Add about 8 to 10 drops of either peppermint or eucalyptus essential oil or mix half and half.
  3. Put a towel over your head and breath in the steam for about five to ten minutes.
  4. Don’t get too close to the steam as you can burn yourself.
  5. BREATHE 🙂

If you would like to fight germs the natural way rather than with chemicals, try natural antimicrobial soap.

It’s easy to make and here’s the recipe for hand soap:

  1.  6 ounces of natural liquid soap.
  2. 30 drops of eucalyptus essential oil.
  3. 30 drops of lavender essential oil.
  4. 15 drops of orange essential oil.
  5. 2 drops of tea tree oil.

Put all ingredients in a glass pump dispenser.
